header: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 151/2019 (Vitthal Dhondiba Bhanage Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000813­2019

background.text: 1) Applicant filed this application under section 439 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 on his arrest in C.R.No. 21 of 2019 of Wai Police station, for the offences punishable under Sec. 302, 295 of Indian Penal Code.

arguments.text: 2) Accusation against applicant­accused is that, on 21.01.2019 applicant­accused has damaged idol of deity Shri.Datta in a temple owned by one Ramchandra Dhondiba Bhanage and thereby intentionally insulted the religion of nearby persons. It is also alleged that, thereafter he went in the home, quarreled with his mother and pushed her head on the wall and thereby committed her murder.

It is also alleged that, thereafter he went in the home, quarreled with his mother and pushed her head on the wall and thereby committed her murder.

arguments.text: 3) It is contended by the applicant that, he is innocent, he is behind the bars since 21.01.2019, nothing is to be recovered at the instance of applicant, there is no evidence of any eye­witness and complaint is made on hearsay information. It is further contended that, applicant is senior citizen and suffering from high blood pressure, he has no criminal background, he is ready to abide all the conditions imposed while allowing the application. Hence, prayed for bail.

It is further contended that, applicant is senior citizen and suffering from high blood pressure, he has no criminal background, he is ready to abide all the conditions imposed while allowing the application.

arguments.text: 4) Prosecution submitted its say at Exh.5 and contended that, informant is Police Patil of the village where applicant resides, other witnesses are also from the same village. Applicant may make any inducement, promise or threats to the witnesses so as to dissuade them from disclosing the facts before police. Investigation is in progress.

arguments.text: 5) Heard Advocate for accused and learned A.P.P.

argumentSentences.text: 5) Heard Advocate for accused and learned A.P.P.

arguments.text: 6) It is submitted by Advocate for the applicant that, the alleged incident was narrated falsely by the informant before police and accordingly the crime was registered. In fact, deceased came in contact with door which was forcefully pushed and she sustained serious injury and accused was not having reason to kill his mother. The family members have narrated true incident subsequently. Advocate for accused further submitted that, during investigation, statements of witnesses are recorded and they have stated before police the true incident occurred. Even informant has subsequently stated before police that, he was under wrong impression and therefore, lodged report.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 19th March, 2019 Satara
processedText:
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 151/2019 (Vitthal Dhondiba Bhanage Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01­000813­2019 
---header-ends---
1) Applicant filed this application under section 439 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 on his arrest in C.R.No. 21 of 2019 of Wai Police station, for the offences punishable under Sec. 302, 295 of Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
2) Accusation against applicant­accused is that, on 21.01.2019 applicant­accused has damaged idol of deity Shri.Datta in a temple owned by one Ramchandra Dhondiba Bhanage and thereby intentionally insulted the religion of nearby persons. It is also alleged that, thereafter he went in the home, quarreled with his mother and pushed her head on the wall and thereby committed her murder. 
---argument-ends---
3) It is contended by the applicant that, he is innocent, he is behind the bars since 21.01.2019, nothing is to be recovered at the instance of applicant, there is no evidence of any eye­witness and complaint is made on hearsay information. It is further contended that, applicant is senior citizen and suffering from high blood pressure, he has no criminal background, he is ready to abide all the conditions imposed while allowing the application. Hence, prayed for bail. 
---argument-ends---
4) Prosecution submitted its say at Exh.5 and contended that, informant is Police Patil of the village where applicant resides, other witnesses are also from the same village. Applicant may make any inducement, promise or threats to the witnesses so as to dissuade them from disclosing the facts before police. Investigation is in progress. 
---argument-ends---
5) Heard Advocate for accused and learned A.P.P. 
---argument-ends---
6) It is submitted by Advocate for the applicant that, the alleged incident was narrated falsely by the informant before police and accordingly the crime was registered. In fact, deceased came in contact with door which was forcefully pushed and she sustained serious injury and accused was not having reason to kill his mother. The family members have narrated true incident subsequently. Advocate for accused further submitted that, during investigation, statements of witnesses are recorded and they have stated before police the true incident occurred. Even informant has subsequently stated before police that, he was under wrong impression and therefore, lodged report. 
---argument-ends---
7) It is submitted by learned A.P.P. that, the FIR is disclosing the confession by accused and there were two incidents. 
---argument-ends---
8) At this stage, the contrary statements made by the witnesses cannot be considered, the matter is under investigation. Considering nature of the offence I am not inclined to grant bail to accused. Hence, application deserves to be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) Cr.Misc. Application No.151 of 2019 is rejected. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 19th March, 2019 Satara
